alert.note: Alert for Cochise (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 12 at 3:03PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southeast Arizona, including the following county, Cochise. * WHEN...Until 615 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 302 PM MST, Doppler radar estimates that between 0.50 and 1.25 inches of rain has fallen across portions of western and southwestern Cochise county. This will cause small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sierra Vista, Whetstone, Huachuca City, St. David, Tombstone, Dragoon, Pearce-Sunsites, Fort Huachuca, Fairbank and Charleston. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
